titleStmt.title: The spirit of prelacie, yet working. Or, Truth from under a cloud, in a relation, of that great, and publike contestation had in Glocester, July, 1644. Written then, and now published, as it were of necessity. Together, with a postscript, containing some generall and perticular observations, upon Master Edwards his Gangræna. / By Robert Bacon, M.A. minister of the Gospel.
titleStmt.author: Bacon, Robert, M.A.

titleStmt.title: The spirit of prelacie, yet working. Or, Truth from under a cloud, in a relation, of that great, and publike contestation had in Glocester, July, 1644. Written then, and now published, as it were of necessity. Together, with a postscript, containing some generall and perticular observations, upon Master Edwards his Gangræna. / By Robert Bacon, M.A. minister of the Gospel.
titleStmt.author: Bacon, Robert, M.A.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R.L. for Giles Calvert, at the black-spread-eagle at the west end of Pauls.,

notesStmt.note: On the action by the city of Gloucester in suppressing Bacon's preaching and expelling him from the city.
With a preliminary order to print.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
